intro: Grevillea brevicuspis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved grevillea, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It is characterized by its narrow, needle-like leaves and clusters of bright red or orange flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It is a member of the Proteaceae family and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens. Grevillea brevicuspis is also an important plant for local wildlife, providing nectar for birds and insects.
